summary: Four Health and Human Services agencies had key roles in the federal COVID-19 response. Our prior reports noted shortcomings to that response, including possible political interference. Our panel of government, academic, and non-profit experts identified steps agencies can take to protect against such interference: Set agency policies to prohibit interference and allow transparency in addressing allegations Train agency staff on how to implement policies Use...
title: CARES Act: Experts Identified Safeguards to Help Selected HHS Agencies Protect Against Potential Political Interference
